Reviews.Title: “Excellent View!”
Reviews.Author: snaggedy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Mayan several times. The staff are always very helpful and pleasant. The view facing the ocean is beautiful, and the rooms have outdoor balconies. The rooms are clean and well kept. The Inn has an outdoor pool, small gameroom and free breakfast. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of management!”
Reviews.Author: adrdlc
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last night and I ended up sleeping in my truck. At first it was a nice room and had a great ocean view. I went to take a shower and cockroaches came out of the water temp knobs. I called the front desk to let them know and they did not even seem to care. All they said was "we will call you in the morning with your wake up call". I just checked out. I was on the seventh floor so I know they had to be throughout the inn.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the hilton”
Reviews.Author: Shannon S
Reviews.Content: If you go to the hotel without high expectations you won't be dissapointed. Everything about the hotle is medeoker at best with the exception of beach front. From our room on the 4th floor to our spot on the beach was a 5 minute walk. The beach at this area is traffic free and less crouded than the areas north and south. The room's bathroom was extra small, you could even say tiny. A large person would have to step into the tub to shut the door. The continental "breakfast" was hardly worth the trip to the 1st floor. They were usually out of food items and didn't have an attendant to replenish items. Other raters mentioned several varities of bugs, we sall none of any kind. There was no open resturant on the hotel grounds, just one beside the hotel. The food there was ok, but not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget conscious travelers”
Reviews.Author: sarah k
Reviews.Content: For the price, it was a good hotel. At check in we got a free upgrade to oceanfront so that was a nice surprise. The room was clean, breakfast was not much but enough to get you by until lunch. Parking lot is kind of hard to get out of but there were always spots available. It is next to the ocean deck bar which goes all night, didnt bother us any but if you arent into that sort of thing it might bother you. The staff was really friendly and the stretch of beach it is on is awesome. There are no vehicles on it and its pretty private. Very nice for us as we have a small child. Really enjoyed the stay here and it was a lot less money than we could of spent on other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “good 4 the money”
Reviews.Author: maribeth2
Reviews.Content: an average hotel with a good location close to everything noisey weekends, friendly evening staff, great bat tenders elevators were very small and dirty, loby floors usualy wet. the pool was OK and the beach was right in front of the hotel the water was 78 degrees very nice. the guy on the desk late afternoon into the night was a great asset to the plase and was very friendly quite the individual.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was a little out of date”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel was ok. They had a bar but it was never opened. The cleaning staff was excellent. The location was great, the beach was beautiful. I went there for the race but enjoyed the area for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: terrido21
Reviews.Content: I rented it was called ocean front efficiency. Well to start off their was only one front desk person we had to wait to check in for like 1hour..the room was next to where they drop the trash so the smell was horrible.the other thing when I went to the room the room service didn't provide shampoo,toothpaste I had to keep calling the front desk.also when we went to the pool we had to wait for someone to come out so they can provide us with towels they didn't have any outside it was a group of 5 of us and they only gave us 2 towels..I was mad!!another thing the noise at night from the ocean deck was so loud we couldn't even sleep...the kitchen deffinetly was outdated didn't want to cook their and they only provided one pack of coffee.. I would definetly not stay their again...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindy p
Reviews.Content: To begin with the front desk staff is very nice but....the hotel is old and could really use some fixing up...It's on the beach but don't let oceanview fool you...Our view was of the Ocean Deck restaurant and to see ocean you had to lean across the balcony. At check in although we had paid for our stay in full and in the description of the hotel it stated free continental breakfast,free wi-fi, in-room safe and free parking well it wasn't they charge you an additional 8.00 per day for what they call incidentals. The rooms are ok for a few night stay but again could use some work. Our bathtub was alittle scary because it caved in alittle when you stepped in. Also the water pressure was very low. Had a little Tiki bar that was priced reasonable and Barbara,older lady, is nice and friendly. They also do not have anyone manning the parking lot so good luck in the evening finding a spot because everyone going to the Ocean Deck restaurant thats all the parking. The day after we checked in a housekeeper was caught stealing. Like I said mixed feelings because for the price and being right on the beach and the staff being nice it's hard to give a bad rating. Would I stay here again probably not if I could find something else but if I had to I would not take my kids here.

Reviews.Title: “The area and employees made it a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Sonyacm
Reviews.Content: A gf and i stayed here a week and not knowing what this hotel was about decided to book tt as it was a great deal on expedia.. Will have to tell you it a perfect spot ! You are right next door to the ocean club with great music. Now if u dont like any noise at all then maybe not your place but the music coming from ocean club wasnt a big deal t uss i mean u r on vocation nothing wrong with music :) and food right on the beach where its a party every night! There is a store next door open 24 hrs hours if u need something, There is a bar also few feet away from this hotel called tailgators where they have music and food also. and is next to a pier The staff at this hotel was extremely kind !! And front desk who please forgive me for not remembering her name but she was originally from PA was so helpfull and so good at her job of making us feel welcomed and to accomadate anything we needed help on. The rooms r not a 4 or 5 star but it was clean with fridges and microwave! There is a new huge place to eat that was to be done in May 2012 out on the pier that lights up at night and i heard its going to be fabulous and its just few feet away so there are so many options while staying at this hotel!! They have a bar inside this hotel and outside on the deck area and they do offer continental breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good Visit”
Reviews.Author: Derkin31
Reviews.Content: Had a good visit. Was a good hotel and will stay there again. Only issue was small elevators made it hard during the weekend to get down stairs when people was checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: cyndi267
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayan Inn June 26-30 and had a great time, the motel was clean, everyone was friendly from check in/out to cleaning. We did have to ask for a frying pan and pot for the kitchen but they had this in the there by the time we got back to our rooms. We have found a new tradition! Will be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 29kittkatt
Reviews.Content: I was worried about booking this hotel because of the negative reviews but I'm so glad I chose this hotel. I booked a room for 5 nights at a very reasonable rate and my mother did also. We booked separately and when we got there, they offered us connecting rooms. We were in ocean view rooms with balconies and I think the ocean view is just as good as ocean front at this hotel. The rooms are big and clean and the staff made our stay even better. They are so friendly and our housekeeping man was so helpful and friendly. He cleaned our room very well and always provided us with plenty of towels. Our towel rack broke off the wall and they fixed it within 5 minutes of us reporting it.I LOVED this hotel and we plan to make the Mayan Inn a yearly tradition for our family. Anyone giving bad reviews must be paid by other hotels. The only complaint my husband had was the slow elevators, but I didn't mind them. We were on 7th floor and I never had to wait more than 3 or so minutes for one.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: SusanB1965
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed here many times & will stay again. Although the hotel is nothing special it's in a convenient location with great beach access. We always stay ocean front on the 8th floor. My biggest complaint is the bird poo on the balcony. I know it can't be comletely prevented but it could certainly be cleaned up better. I'm certain the balcony of the room we had in January hadn't been washed since the last hurricane. Joann at the front desk is wonderful and I'm glad to know that Barbara is still the bartender. (I just wish the bar was open more often) Yes, the elevators are old and slow but when I'm on vacation I try not to be in a hurry. The breakfast could be improved but it's acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: M0m45
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks nice and inviting, the staff is very friendly.... then you step into the filthy elevators, to the filthy hallways, to your gross room. We had ocean front so that was the only reason we stayed there the two nights. Splurge and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Older, but clean and definitely more budget friendly than others... close to the boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: brigitte7186
Reviews.Content: The older reviews scared me on here when I purchased a room online. The ones saying this place is horrible are wrong. Or they just had a bad experience, which can happen at ANY hotel. You know some people are more picky than others and I hate when uptight people ruin the reputation of places with STANDARD accomodations... you can't pay $125 for an ocean front view room with a private balcony and expect the place to look like the Hilton. That's just unreasonable. I was on a budget, looking for a room with a nice view to watch the sunrise. This was in my price range and I'm happy I went with it. Here is the truth, coming from a 36 week pregnant, 26 year old girl who rented a room for her significant other's 30th birthday on Father's Day. I'm not some kid on "spring break". The hotel IS older, and I would recommend that the elevator be updated, but the rooms are clean. Customer service is very good. I did not see one single bug, so if this used to be a problem, it isn't now. For an extra $10, you can extend your stay from 11am to 1pm. The air conditioner worked very well. The tub did drain a bit slow, but it was clean. There was a mini fridge, coffee maker and microwave available for use and all worked fine. There was one small stain on the carpet, but you could tell the carpet was clean.. again the hotel is just a bit older. The beds did creak some when you moved around in them, but they were SUPER comfortable. I'm pregnant, so that counts for something! I like a bed that's a bit older and broken in. I don't like firm beds, but that's just my preference. The pillows were AWESOME. Super fluffy. I was surprised by that actually. The soap they provide smells pretty darn good, but I would bring my own shampoo next time. Theirs isn't bad, it's just the generic hotel stuff and I'm picky about my hair being soft. I did not use the safe. I took my laptop and left it in the room. No one messed with it. The front desk has towels available for when you're done swimming. Downstairs has a bar with a pool table. The pool goes to over 10 feet deep! Since the other reviews said that karaoke was a problem at the bottom and bird droppings on the balcony were a problem at the top, I requested a room at mid level. We had no problems with either one of these issues. The free breakfast consisted of juice, coffee, milk, oatmeal, 4 kinds of cereal, pre-packaged danishes and muffins and toast with jelly. I don't know why people would complain about that. That's pretty standard in the places I've gotten free breakfast. The boardwalk is super close. We walked to the mini carnival, restaurants, bars (didn't go in those though), beach shops, etc.. The pictures make it look like it's kind of in a dead area, but it's not at all. The roof on a FEW of the balconies is cracked, but that's just because it's older. The balcony was clean. It's clear from the condition of the hotel, that people swim a lot that stay in the rooms. It's got a used-beachy feel, but to me, that's not bad. I mean, they are right on the water. I will definitely stay here again if I come back. I'd rather save $30-$50 on the room per night compared to other places and have that money to do fun things. =D I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lynnette D
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Mayan and had no issues at all. Clean room, friendly staff and Barbara was a great bartender! The hotel could definitely use some updates (the shower head) but all in all a very enjoyable place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel but needs updated”
Reviews.Author: JackC48
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and can always show up and get a room for a cheap price with fantastic views. I love to sleep with the patio door open and hear the wind and ocean all night long (from Minnesota so we don't have that) and this hotel delivers on that! The staff is always nice, the room is as clean as it is going to get. The rooms are small and outdated but if you are on a budget and want some of the best views you will ever have stay here. The higher you stay the better the views! The pool is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: I was able to stay at the Mayan Inn for almost a month and over that time was able to watch and meet the staff, Everyone at the front desk was great, especially Mike, who was accommodating and super friendly while maintaining his professionalism, honestly the location, the view and the rooms are great but those can be found many places, the reason ill go back to the Mayan Inn is because of the people

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I've stayed in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: Agb1971
Reviews.Content: I googled the hotel because I didn't remember the name of the hotel next door called the Roomba Inn which I've stayed at before. Little Sid I know the website was was disguised as gets room.com - I was quoted a price of $311 and some change. I was like wow, what a great deal, but I was always under the impression I was booking directly with the hotel and not a third party. My friend and I drove a little over 3 hours from South Florida only to be told by the grumpiest old man that he didn't see a reservation for us. Then he proceeds to tell me about Xpedia reservation that has not have time to enter. He then makes me sign two receipts. One for the $311 and a second one for the complimentary breakfast, wireless Internet and surcharge for parking. He trashed Expedia saying they always are booking rooms they don't have. He said in a rude tone "in going to have to upgrade you to an Ocean front view. What a jerk... He asked be for my phone number and my cell phone is new so I had to look the number up which took all of 30 seconds. This reservation was put on my American Express card and I told him I would file a dispute with Anex. He told me I booked through expedia and I needed to read their terms and conditions. I went to the website and clicked on the terms and conditions. It took me to godaddy.com. I have to commend the head cleaning manager who was so accommodating to our needs. I'm very disappointed the inside bar and lounge was never open. The Internet access kept going out. Very frustrating!!! Our toilet was running when we checked in. We couldnt call the front desk because the phone lines were down. I had to take the elevator to the front desk to complain. The guy came up and said we needed a flapper. We had to make a 2nd call the next day and it was finally fixed around 4:30. We had guest visiting. They had to rent a room at the Roomba inn because our hotel only had one parking space per room. Never again. The guy that checked us in should be fired.....

Reviews.Title: “Great for family stay and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: jordan311
Reviews.Content: Great value and good room not a lot of amenities but good pool and great beach access, good bar/tiki hut minutes walk away from great restaurants, boardwalk and pier very friendly and efficient staff especially the maids. Overall a wonderful hotel for the price

Reviews.Title: “Love the View”
Reviews.Author: greggwill2
Reviews.Content: We got a real good price on an excellent room. It was a corner room with three views of the ocean and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Mayan”
Reviews.Author: gmfibes
Reviews.Content: Winged it to Daytona Beach without a reservation booked. Stayed at the Mayan Inn on the beach. Economy hotel at best. Walk-up rates were fairly high with little but some flexibility. Oceanview room was of good size, relatively clean but smelled of cleaning fluids. (Maid stated they deep cleaned the entire 5th floor the day before....it smelled like it) Hallways were dingy and dark. Charged an additional $5 a day for parking which seemed unreasonable as the parking lot remained half empty all night. Breakfast offering in the morning were sparse at best....toast or cereal...juice or coffee. Probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here! Laptop was stolen right out of my room!”
Reviews.Author: Kacy R
Reviews.Content: The room for the price is accommodating and I can't complain. Its really cheap to stay here. Outside pool bar has a great bartender and on weekends overlooks a happening next door beach bar/restaurant. However, if you stay on the south side you will hear the music until 300am. I left one afternoon for 2 hrs and my laptop was stolen right off my bed, no forced entry. This is apparently the second time this has happened this month in this hotel. Good thing my purse was locked in a safe. So there is internal theft going on. White man came to my door three times acting like he was accidentally in the wrong place and prank called me once, likely checking to see when I was going to be leaving, then saw me leave, and when I came back to my room, laptop was gone. This was a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. Police officer helped me convince them to refund my last two nights stay. THIS IS NOT A SAFE PLACE FOR ANYONE or a SINGLE WOMAN.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jprairie
Reviews.Content: Balconies on the 8th and 7th floors are not usable. There are bird droppings all over everything. My husband slid on the balcony. It was gross. We asked to have our room moved, they did not care said they clean the balcony everyday. I know this is not true. They never even cleaned our room the first day. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't”
Reviews.Author: T N
Reviews.Content: We came here and stayed for three days. The first night we were sitting in the room chatting and the roaches started coming out of everywhere. Day two they were out during the day. We took a walk and when we came back we moved rooms. We did not have any problems after that. But it still was yuck. How do you eat in a hotel with roaches? So we did not even eat the sub par breakfast. Just go somewhere else. And there was also dirt on the bathroom floor and all around the fan in the bathroom. We never allowed anyone in to our room we went to the front desk and got our own clean towels.

Reviews.Title: “WORST EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Sal1hyco
Reviews.Content: I came here for the NCA nationals competition. I was here for 5 days, they did not bring towels, nobody was ever around to help. The bed spreads looked like they had never been washed. On top of all that my lap top was stolen right off my bed. The manager did not care one bit and refused to ask her staff. She would not refund me only said for me to fill out a stolen form from the police. The people here need to learn respect for others. Nobody deserves to be treated the way I was. Don't let the pictures fool you. NEVER GO THIS NASTY HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT EVEN ATTEMPT TO CONSIDER.”
Reviews.Author: htup
Reviews.Content: Nasty. Straight up. I asked for a new blanket because the previous one i had contained many strands of hair that were not even mine. I received a new one that STILL had hair all through it. Now I have to go buy my own blanket because the service isn't trustworthy.

Reviews.Title: “NEED TO BE SHUT DOWN ASAP!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nlb1980
Reviews.Content: I wouldnt recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. This is my first family vacation and we booked 2 rooms. Well when we got to the hotel they told us they charge for parking (ugh), we received our 2rooms 4 floors away from each other. We ordered to rooms with Ocean View only one room got it. When I got to my room. 216 there was no tub(not that i would bathe in it), and on top of that it was a handicap room with roaches and my ceiling was cracked. They do not change sheets everyday or bring new clean towels everyday unless request it and then its like they have an attitude when you call. The staff (mike) and the manager Theresa are very rude no kind of Customer Service. So after enough fussing and arguing i got my ocean view with out the roaches an without it bein handicap. But the tub has a nasty long brown stain amd the hallways smell like someone uses it instead of the restroom. its very loud at night from the ocean deck restaurant right next door. I would love to know who I could report this hotel and staff to nd get something done. nobody wants to go online and see a nice hotel book it and then when you arrive it looks like a dump. this hotel needs to be closed until further notice. pics coming soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Baggett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayan during August with our son who uses a wheelchair and we were pleasantly surprised by the location and staff. Although the parking lot is small, the staff was very helpful and made sure that we always had an easy location to load and unload our son. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The boardwalk and restraunts are close to the hotel and made it a great vacation. We hope to return this year.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: SRS53
Reviews.Content: Really needs an upgrade. The bed was comfy but the tub didn't drain and it could have been a little cleaner. Pretty noisy with the Ocean Deck right next door. Breakfast was very lame, even out of coffee one morning. Having to pay for parking is really aggravating.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Breanna B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two friends. We walked in the room, and there were cigarette burns on the comforter. Then the microwave looked like it was melted. The "complimentary" was awful. There was no coffee and no toast, it was all out. And there was no help around to ask to replace it. When they did replace the hot cross buns, they were FROZEN as if they came out of the freezer. Everyone we talked to said they had a TERRIBLE room and the only reason they stayed there was because it was so cheap. Guess why its so cheap, because its terrible!!!!! The people doing the breakfast and vacuuming in the breakfast room, are the same people that are cleaning the rooms. They don't change the sheets either. That was the WORST hotel i have ever stayed at. It was embarrassing to bring my family there. AND you have to pay for parking, we didn't know that until they already charged it on my credit card. Awful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Please dont”
Reviews.Author: gene4061
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayan Inn the night of 2/15/2012. We checked in at midnight. Upon arrival there was a very loud band playing next door. We found you had to pay to park at the hotel. We got to our room and immediately found bugs crawling on the wall. The room was also in need of updating. We called the front desk and asked for a new room. For 10.00 we were updated to an oceanfront king. We hed to forcibly push the door open. The room also needed updating. There was paint falling from the ceiling and walls. The fridge in the kitchen was dented and rusty. Probably a good value for spring break or bike week partiers. Would not recomend for a family vacation. We were supposed to stay 5 nights but checked out the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: joe5634515
Reviews.Content: I just visited the Mayan again for a weekend mini vacation. It was good except for the roaches. It wasn't too bad just a few german cockroaches I saw. They really need to get a hold on the bug problem. I do not know if they have a pest control. If they could rid the building of roaches it would be a perfect budget hotel. This does not mean I will not stay there again but I hope they will tend to this problem. There is a free breakfast in the morning that saves some $$ and the location is good. I along with my kids enjoy the immediate beach access

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach - the old style”
Reviews.Author: fflbrgst
Reviews.Content: There are two types of hotels on Daytona Beach these days - the brand new hi-rises charging big $$$ and the places that have been around for a long time, slowly disintegrating into the sand. The Mayan falls into the second category, but you could do a lot worse (for more money, too.) Rooms are not huge, but not tiny either. Carpets have been updated, beds are comfortable, TVs are new. Bugs - I saw some tiny spider-mites running around the bathroom sink in the mornings, and one fast-moving thing one evening, but nothing else. Note that if you open up the balcony door in the summer, you are likely to get more bugs. A/C worked fine (for a warm January). The cheapest rooms face to the side, where you will be treated to the sounds of the band playing the Ocean Deck next door, playing until the late closing time. You'll pay more for the ocean view rooms, and the higher the room number, the further away from the Ocean Deck you'll be. If you come down for Speedweeks regularly, then you have probably experienced some pretty bad rooms if you have shopped around for cheap prices, the Mayan will be a step up from most any of them. It's close by to the downtown beach clubs and souvenir shops and the pier (which is closed for renovations). 100 yards from the end if International Speedway Boulevard (ISB in local talk), so about 4 miles from DIS and all the chain restaurants in that area. The continental breakfast is cold cereal and pre-packaged pastries, but there are plenty of restaurants in the area to get a good meal. The bar is only open on certain nights, but with the Ocean Deck next door, that shouldn't deter you. The pool is not heated, but was clean, on a raised deck ocean-side. Desk staff were friendly and efficient. Cleaning staff left some easy-to-spot things uncleaned - stains on walls or doors that might have washed off when still fresh, and dirt on the in-room fridge. The free Wifi offered was so weak, that the free internet from the Ocean Deck next door had a stronger signal.

Reviews.Title: “A decent Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattKatcoff
Reviews.Content: The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean, no bug issues. The staff was nice, and this was a comfortable size room, but there were some issues. First the good stuff: The biggest benefit between this hotel and the motels I have stayed at in Daytona previously was the provided breakfast - dry cereal, instant oatmeal and grits, toast with jam or butter, packaged muffins and danishes, coffee, tea, milk, and juice. Last time I was at a hotel in Daytona, the breakfast was a box of doughnuts and when it was gone it was gone - this was much better. The not so good: Not all rooms have balconies, so don't expect one or chose to stay here based on that. In our room without a balcony, the windows wouldn't even open. If you need a non-smoking room for medical reasons, don't stay here. The room smelled fine when the hotel wasn't full, as it filled up - especially for biker week - I quickly found you will smell smoke if anyone nearby smokes. It doesn't seem like they set aside certain floors or sections for non-smokers. There is a pool, but my roommate who previously worked as a lifeguard was worried about it since he knows pool chemicals should be monitored hourly and there is never anyone monitoring the hotel pool. Otherwise the expected okay hotel supplies - disintegratingly thin tissues, weak free internet signal (though it worked better for my roommate's high-tech computer). The nightclub next door is loud from about 10p-2a. As a heavy sleeper, this did not bother me, but my roommate is a light sleeper and had lots of trouble sleeping. Then the maid service came around (on our specific floor) around 10a and were quite loud, so he didn't have much chance to sleep in. Your experience will depend on your specific sleeping habits, and possibly where your room is located as ours was across from the maid service "room" (which is on each floor) but my roommate did not sleep well during our trip. In terms of the maid service, I do not like to have my room cleaned unless I have an extended stay, so I can't speak specifically about it except that the room was clean when we got there. Although I did find the tip envelope oddly presumptuous, especially with the "God bless" written on it, but that may just be me.

Reviews.Title: “Second time, not a charm”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mayan Inn in 2011 and thought it was a great place for not only location, but service and room quality as well. We returned for a night this passed weekend, and it will probably be the last time we visit this hotel. I paid a little extra to book an Oceanfront King Bed room. All was as we remembered, front desk was friendly and efficient. I found the $5 per day parking fee a little ridiculuous. Once we got in the room our opinions greatly changed. We stayed in room 704. The condition as far as updates in the room were adequate compared to our last stay, but with a few unpleasant changes. The bathroom mirror hadn't been cleaned, so a stranger's tooth paste scum stared back at us. There was a razor form the previous tenant ( or perhaps maid?) left on the bathroom vanity as well. The outside of the mini-fridge was covered in a white substance, it almost looked like paint, but can't be certain, and I was afraid to touch it to find out. Yes, Ocean Deck was loud and so was the AC in the room, but that's not a big deal. The worst part was the sheets. They were as clean as you can expect a Daytona Beach hotel under 4 starts to be, but the smell, oh my gosh the smell. The sheets smelled like they were washed in seafood. Not the nice hint of the sea that a lot of beach side hotels have, but like I was sleeping in a plate of Shrimp Scampi. My husband and I both bathed before going to bed, so it wasn't us! It was the sheets! We made it a late night on the town, so by the time we got to bed it was late, and we were too tired to go through calling the front desk and having the sheets changed for our 1 nights stay. To say the least it was neausating, and we slept on top of the covers. The location is great, but the upkeep is greatly lacking. I also thought $95.00 was a little pricey for a hotel room in off season, even if it was "ocean front" on the 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Dear God no...”
Reviews.Author: razorfish355
Reviews.Content: In most cases, I go out of my way to post good things about a hotel. All my wife and I need are clean sheets, a hot shower and peaceful atmosphere. Whether it be 1 star or 5 is almost irrelevant, as long as these minimal requirements are met. That being said, we got the Mayan Inn through Priceline.com and I instantly came here to check the reviews. They made me nervous, and my fears were confirmed by our one night stay. We just got back and we were never more happy to get home due to this place. Firstly, there were tiny bugs all over the bathroom, especially at night. We were situated on the 3rd floor and were kept up all night by the Ocean Deck restaurant next door, extremely loud music permeating throughout the building. The place did not close until 2 A.M. The A / C unit was extremely loud as well, so unless you are blind and deaf, you may want to choose another hotel. Next, we received an errant phone call from the front desk at 11:30 at night regarding a mystery smoke alarm. For whatever reason, it supposedly went off in their office. And now the rooms condition: dirty! (surprise, surprise). The sheets had an odd red stain which was possibly pizza...or worse. The mattresses were terribly old and had no firmness left. Although their site is trumpeting newly renovated rooms, we must have been one of the lucky ones to receive a room from a bygone era... Breakfast was marginally passable with breakfast cereal, bread, coffee, and muffins. Pool appeared clean, but we did not risk it. So if you do not want to sleep and enjoy the company of bugs on the beachside, help yourself. But I cannot give this place my hearty recommendation. People who have in the past, I have no idea who put them up to it. Steer clear, folks.

Reviews.Title: “Average accommodations, great location”
Reviews.Author: SalvageConsultant
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay in Daytona Beach last minute and were looking for a reasonably priced hotel close to Main Street. The Mayan Inn fit the bill. Despite the reviews, we decided to take a chance for the one night we'd be there. It was well worth it. We arrived about 7:00PM, and the clerk couldn't find our reservation. We had booked through AOL travel the day before, and the hotel didn't have any record of it. He spent about 20 minutes on the phone trying to get the reservation faxed to him. Once he knew it was on the way and had verbal confirmation that we had paid, he checked us in. This seemed to be an AOL issue, not one for the hotel itself. The room was adequate with a great ocean view and balcony. We heard the TV from the room next door before we went out for dinner, but nothing when we got back. The bed was okay, but needed a new mattress. That said, we slept pretty well. Honestly, the worst part of the room was the towels. They were thin and could have used some fabric softener. We'll definitely consider the Mayan Inn the next time we stay in Daytona, and we stay there about 5 times a year. We've stayed in better hotels and worse along the beach, but this hotel is worth a look if you don't expect "five stars."

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for Bike Week”
Reviews.Author: Marc C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mayan a few times during bike week. It is one of the more affordable options in spite of its' great location. Location--5 stars--on the ocean and a 5 minute walk, stumble or crawl from Main street Staff--4 stars-- They are always helpful polite and friendly. Condition--2 stars--getting worn This is a former Best Western and is now own by a group that has a number of Daytona properties. It is a typical older beach hotel. Think Motel 6 on the water. The lobby is plenty nice, the pool is ok. The rooms are reasonably clean but really showing some wear. The metal surfaces and balconies are pitted and discolored from the salt air. They have just started what looks to be a major renovation. I expect it will be some improved by the spring. I'd suggest it as a good bet for bike week, spring break, a guys weekend but, probably not for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “not the best beach time”
Reviews.Author: fragments
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times, and although its older,,and a little run down, I have always had great reviews for location and staff,,,but when I stayed this summer with my teens, it was awful,,,i booked online, like always,,,for oceanfront non smoking, got there saturday to check in,,after waiting for 35 mins in line,,got up to room to find out,,it was not oceanfront,,went back down,,waited 45 mins,,to get a choic of a non smoking king bed,,,i had two teens and my spouse,,or a smoking room,,,,we took the two beds,,but my health took a dive,,due to the smoke, I have ashma,,the desk blew me off with,,,the rate your paying,,it a great deal,,any room will do,,,,,i will questin if i ever stay there again,,

Reviews.Title: “Clean, updated rooms with friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mayan Inn over a very rainy weekend October 7-9, 2011. The staff was friendly, the rooms were newly renovated and clean. We had daily maid service and free continental breakfast. Due to the rain we did not get to even step foot on the sand, so it was great to have an updated clean room to hang out in. The only negative things I can say about this resort is that our ac in the room, which appeared to be farely new, continuously froze over and leaked all over the carpet, and there were cobwebs on the window to our oceanfront King size bed room. Other than that we were comfortable and got a great deal for the price we paid. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “At least they did not charge us for the roaches”
Reviews.Author: Charlene M
Reviews.Content: This was a spur of the moment trip. The room was absolutely nasty. The vent in shower/bathroom was clogged with dark gray dust and mold. I covered the bed with our beach-towels from home, slept with the lights on. The envelope for which a tip for maid service was expected remains empty. However, my boyfriend did use it to smash a roach just prior to leaving. Maybe they will get the hint. I would recommend camping in the parking lot, as it is much cleaner. The Continental breakfast is pre-packaged danishes set out. The lobby is beautiful, once past that, it just gross. Will never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Favril
Reviews.Content: I am currently in the MOST disgusting hotel I have ever visited. We paid $100 a night for a king bed and a sofa- got no bedding for the sofa- and attitude from the front desk staff. I will NEVER be back... Oh- and everything smells like urine. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not the worst...”
Reviews.Author: gjones754
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Mayan before and generally like the accommodations and the fact it is so close to the boardwalk. I was disappointed this trip. The room was not as clean as it has been in the past...we had to pay for parking and use of the safe...new charges...the "continental breakfast" was basically pre-packaged danishes, muffins and cereals. The coffee was horribly weak and the orange juice watered down. advertised from 7-10, but at 9 a.m. there was hardly anything left. We had to go to the front desk to ask for assistance. In other words, it was nothing to write home about. We are local -from Central Florida-and like to take our family vacation at Daytona...the cousins can meet and the boardwalk is always a fun thing in the evening. The desk was okay, but became annoyed because we had to ask for more towels and more pillows. We reserved the room for 5...even asked for roll away, but had to request it at the desk also! Not the best trip, but we will try Mayan again...it has become a tradition to stay there and I hate to break tradition over one average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more !”
Reviews.Author: Jennyyyy54
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through hotwire.com and did not know what hotel I was getting until after I paid for it. I was aghast after finding out and reading the reviews. After arriving at the hotel I could have jumped for joy !!!...I got a great price online and paid the x-tra $10 for an oceanfront room. The staff were wonderful, the room was clean & comfortable, the pool area was immaculate and just steps from the beach. The breakfast consisted of coffee, juices, cereal, bagels which was more than adequate. There is a restaurant/bar right next door and if you're on your balcony in the evening you can hear their music but we slept with our door open to hear the ocean and DIDN'T hear the music from inside. It's definitely a great hotel especially for the money...$57 along with $10 upgrade and $5/day parking. I don't understand the reason for charging for parking but oh well. The only reason I didn't give it an excellent review is that I'd booked a Smoking Room and was given a Non-Smoking and told they didn't have any others due to carpets being cleaned. I saw that there were many vacant oceanfront rooms available so not sure about that.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Angie10707
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel. We read the review and were not sure we wanted to stay. Called the hotel itself and spoke with the desk clerk and felt better about our selection. We did have a few problems. The rooms we booked were not on the same floor but the clerk was able to change to same floor but not together as we had asked at booking. We requested one King size bed and received two queen size in each room. Parking $5.00 a day and tax on that amount.. The fold lock on the door was so loose it almost came out. Air condition was fair as it seem to go under 70 degree in our rooms. We were also suppose to have a ocean view.. We were on the side of the hotel that faced the bar be we could view down the beach. We foolishly thought we would be on the ocean side. Elevator were like Sauna. No Frills at all. Dated. Breakfast consisded of Toast, Bagles, cereal, orange juice and milk. If you want something more keep moving. Questionable if we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Motel in a bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: zone77
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend night in July (9). Here's what's good. Location ; Hotel is situated in a great location. Boardwalk, Gift shops and restaurants are within walking distance. Hotel has many beach front rooms. Everything else about this hotel is pretty horrible. Parking is limited, WIFI internet is difficult to access aftr accessing, the signal is weak. Elevators are small(fits about 6 people comfortably) and slow. Just 2 elevators for like 8 0r 10 floors. Unhelpful staff. Bad front desk/receptionists. Bathroom is like in a Motel 6. Sink is outside and the shower and commode is inside. Old furniture. Restaurant/Bar next door is loud and goes on till late. Cost me $127 but was not worth that much. wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is full of it!”
Reviews.Author: sgoodie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has roaches, nasty bed spreads, nasty bathrooms, pool does not work, staff has horrible attitudes, rooms with kitchens have no supplies in them. My family planned our reunion here and the staff constantly lied about the pool repair and did almost nothn to accommodate our family who had 23 rooms booked at this hotel! This hotel has ruined our whole reunion. We paid almost 8grand to stay here and they had the audacity to offer us $200 to compensate for the bull crap!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Stay_cv
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel and everything was well.... Went to our room on the 4th floor and went to bed for the night, I woke up to use the restroom and when I turned the light on COCKROACHES were crawling over my children!!!! I stayed awake the rest of the night killing them and running to buy roach killer. The next morning i requested a different room and then went to the 5th floor....same thing but the air conditioner didn't work ugh.... never again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location... Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenPreston88
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here July 9-15th. The Saturday we got there, they were shooting fireworks off the pier, which was very easy to see from the room and the boardwalk was hopping. I booked through priceline and got a deal at $55 per night for 7 nights. I chose to upgrade to an oceanfront room for an extra $10/night. The room was very clean and the view of the ocean and pool were great! The only issue is that absolutely nothing worked in the room. The bathroom light, phone, TV, Wi-Fi, the light just as you enter the door, etc.... I told the front desk and they sent someone to fix everything. The only thing that really got fixed was the telephone.... which wasn't really needed to begin with, but oh well. The location is perfect because you can walk to most anywhere you want to go, and the Ocean Deck restaurant next door is accessible from the beach, as well, so if you spend a long day at the ocean you can walk right in (bathing suit and all) and grab a bite to eat. Mike at the front desk is awesome! Any issues that arose he took care of ASAP and his dry sense of humor/ sarcasm was pretty hilarious. Barbara at the Tiki Bar is also great! Definitely the best beachside bartender I have run across... and I have seen quite a few. Very personable, yet professional and seems to go way more than that "extra mile" for her guests. All in all, I would stay again if I got it at the discounted price, but no more than $50 per night. They were also very apologetic about the room mishaps and took the upgrade charges off at once. Clean room, nice pool, tiki bar, ocean view/access.... and if the ocean view isn't cutting it, the handsome security guard will suffice ;) If it weren't for him, I would have left after the second night because the fire alarm in my room decided to go off because of a broken sensor. After an hour, of waiting (after I told the front desk) and it waking my 3-year-old son from a dead sleep, he happened to be on the same floor for another issue and came and pulled it from the wall. So, thank you to Nick, Barb & Mike.

Reviews.Title: “Gross slept with lights on all night and wore shoes to bed...”
Reviews.Author: mommy2536
Reviews.Content: Last minute planning never again lessoned learned...hotel room nasty...cockroaches as roommates..doors didn't close had to put chair in front of door ...

Reviews.Title: “Location good, cleanliness discusting”
Reviews.Author: jdracefanFlorida
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the staff were ok, the maid said she would leave coffee packages, but didn't all the 6 days we were there. They do have a continental breakfast, which is also ok. The problems are the leaky AC where on the balcony was leaking all over & pretty grose to step in plus we must have killed 10 cockroaches climbing the walls, pretty grose, floors are very dirty under the beds along side the headboards seem like they have not been vaccumed for yrs,plus my son was unable to access the free wifi for his xbox, we were told they do not allow access to the xbox gaming. The pool is very big and seemed clean the first few days, but after the Daytona 400 racefans left, the pool was pretty used and dirty. The bar inside is never opened, only the outside tiki bar is, the parking does cost a daily fee. We will be looking elsewhere to spend our vacation in Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “we will never use this hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: deerhunterLee
Reviews.Content: I'm a handi capped person and I really needed my rest at night . what I did get was a group of loud party kids at the pool until midnight . I called the front desk six times in an hour time frame and no one answered the phone,am glad I didn'nt have a med. emer.!!!! Also our balcony door would not lock,this place needs some maintance and staff updating

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: elektrawmn
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, I was very unsure about what we'd find when we arrived for Memorial Day weekend. We were pleasantly surprised with what we found. Check in was a breeze. There were no problems at all with us checking in early. Lobby was simple, but nice and clean. Elevators were a bit slow but was expected from an older hotel. 1st room we were in had some issues with the A/C unit but it was immediately rectified by maintenance. We wound up having to switch rooms because of a continued problem with it but our concerns and needs were instantly addressed by the front desk staff with no problems or attitudes. Beds were extremely comfortable. WiFi was impossible to connect to in the rooms, never tried it out in the common areas. Pool area and beach access were clean and the balconies offered great views of the ocean. Barbara the Tiki Bar bartender was absolutely fabulous... great drinks and great conversation. No issues with checkout... just remember to ask them to take the room safe charges off if you don't use it. Remember this is NOT a luxury hotel. It was clean, affordable and PERFECTLY located to the boardwalk, Ocean Center and lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Mayan Inn is ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: steveyes2001
Reviews.Content: Mayan Inn i thought was good value for money, good location, bar next door is a bit loud, we had a balcony room that over-looked it, but it never bothered us The complimentary breakfast is ok, staff more than helpful We had a 2 double bed room on the 7th floor, basic but ok My friend's 2 teenage children who live close by come and stayed for 2 days Very close to everywhere If you do not have a great deal to spend on a vacation then the Mayan is ok value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Room Fairly Clean, Elsewise Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: CovAmy
Reviews.Content: As stated in the title, the location is great as it's within walking distance of the boardwalk. The room was fairly clean, if you leave the restroom out of the picture. At first glance, the pool looked well maintained, however, when we went to swim there was debris in the bottom including a feminine/sanitary item! We got about 3 hours of sleep, thanks to the carrying on party in the room next door...It took the management until 4:00 a.m. to remove them. (We had to go down to the desk and make numerous complaints in person, as the staff wouldn't answer the phone.) Also, not a big deal, but an additional $5 fee to park there.

Reviews.Title: “Please dont book with Thomas Cook”
Reviews.Author: MikeW7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with Thomascook Flexibletrips in June 2010 as we knew it was going to be a busy weekend with the Rolex 24hr race on at the Speedway.We arrived after a long flight from the U.K. on 28th jan 2011 .to be informed that the Hotel had no booking for us,even though i had a copy of the confirmation invoice.To cut a long story short the lady at the desk was fantastic and found us a room at another hotel up the road in Ormond Beach!We would have loved to stay at the Mayan inn,but were unable to as Thomas cook did not BOOK IT for us!I have contacted Thomas cook a number of times and they just dont want to know!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: jcromwell23
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a group for a conference! We decided to stay here for the location on the beach! The beach was beautiful and you could see the ocean beautifully. The room was fine, better than some beach hotels we have stayed at. The bar next door was really loud but what more can you expect next to a bar during spring break! The pool was nice and the breakfast was fine! I would stay again for the weekend because the location on the beach was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget motel good location”
Reviews.Author: joe5634515
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a little older but a good value for the money. Location is great, and you don't really have to drive anywhere. Breakfast is limited, but who cares it was good and free. The only people who complain about the breakfast are the fat people who like to eat a lot. People who are anal retentive and picky should not stay here. If you want to pay 3 times the amount with the same view go right ahead. It is an awesome hotel at a good price and location. Employees were cool.

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable time on a beautiful beach.”
Reviews.Author: tammyv
Reviews.Content: First of all we booked this hotel for a Valentines and Anniversary trip during speed week, then saw the reviews and were a little worried about the hotel. We were pleasently surprised with our room when we arrived, it was clean, comfortable, and what a view. Yes it is an older hotel but other than the door being hard to close and the noise from the garbage truck at 8 am we had no problems. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable, and we didnt see any bugs at all during our 4 day stay. We spent a lot of time on the balcony and had no issues with the club next door, matter of fact we had to play our own music because we didnt hear theirs. All the personnel we dealt with were professional and nice. So if you want 5 star go up the street and pay 3 times as much. (we do travel alot and have many hotels to compare it too, it is an average Beach hotel). Parking was a negative issue, where there was plenty of spaces they do charge a daily parking fee of $5.00.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fine! Others need to stop whining!”
Reviews.Author: myezzy
Reviews.Content: I read alot of negitives. It is pretty clean. It is in the heart of it all. IT IS ON THE BEACH AND HAS A POOL! king bed, fold out couch, 4 seat table and chairs, micro and fridge. Every room faces the beach! If you want room service breakfast, the $10 over cooked buger and white linen dinner. Go up the street and pay 3 times the price. You want to hang out on the beach, get sand in your toes, jump in the beachfront pool and have a place to lay your head. This is it. Silver spooners, go up the road and sit in your tah, tah room and watch Oprah! Thats why you came to Daytona? Right? The music from the bar does exist? Turn the fan on. They were done at 12:30

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are desperate!”
Reviews.Author: drgreenlee
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews about the Mayan prior to a 2-night stay over the last weekend in January. (Theoretically AFTER the “renovation”.) Unfortunately, my lodging arrangements were made by the volleyball event that I was working and I didn’t have any choice in the matter. I wasn’t expecting luxury. Being former military, I’ve had to sleep in a hole in the ground that I had to dig before I could “check in”. On the positive side, the room temperature was quite pleasant on a chilly winter weekend. There were two Queen-size beds, although that made the rest of the room a bit cramped. And, had my work not kept me away from the room during all daylight hours, I probably would have had a nice view of the Ocean. Of course, if I’d brought anybody along to enjoy a romantic view, they would probably have tossed me off the balcony for selecting such a dump. This hotel’s room style clearly dates back to the 60-70s and hasn’t been updated since. Contrary to the management’s response to earlier negative reviews, there was little “newness” to our room. There was an abundance of mismatched and clearly used furniture. If management says that the linens & carpet were new, I won’t dispute that. However, it has little impact on the overall impression when the floors are littered with debris from previous occupants in the corners and behind the furniture items. As is typical of old hotels, there were few AC outlets for modern electronics, and at least one of those didn’t work. The lights for the enclosed bathroom and separate vanity area are on the same circuit. So, if you need to use the toilet in the middle of the night, you either need to do it in complete darkness, or turn on a light that can annoy anybody still in bed. The vanity faucet had a single control that would tilt to turn on/off, but would not rotate at all to adjust water temperature. The “free Internet access” appeared to be some sort of scam. On the first night, we couldn’t even access their wireless network. My call to the front desk brought a practiced “We don’t know nuthin’ about computers.” When I did eventually connect, it immediately led to a webpage that demanded a virtual biography of personal information. If that wasn’t bad enough, it then took you to a second page that demanded credit card information even as it clearly displayed a charge of $0.00 for the service. Momma didn’t raise no stupid children, so I gave them no useful information and was cheated out of the service. Don’t even think about staying in the south wing if you expect to sleep. Friends staying there reported so much noise from motorcycles & barflies that they couldn’t get to sleep until after 3:00 AM. They were on the top floor. So, if it was that loud up there, imagine those with closer rooms . . . The shared kitchen was in fact NOT locked by management. I have no clue who we were sharing with and made no attempt to use the kitchen. I used the built-in lock and had no problem. The icing on the cake was returning to our room following a 14-hour workday, only to discover that housekeeping had never touched the room. Beds unmade, no clean linens; they never even opened the door! When I called down to complain, I was informed that absolutely no employees were on the premises other than the security guard. Apparently this happens quite frequently as he was very proficient at delivering clean linens to our room; lots of practice. Management says that only 2-3 complaints were received that weekend. Maybe if they were actually present they could have heard all the others. There are many nice hotels in the Daytona area, near the airport & race-track, and great bargains can be had through Priceline & Hotwire. If you must stay on/near the beach, then look carefully before you invest a penny. However, if you really want to be within staggering distance of a noisy bar and plan to pass out oblivious to your surroundings, then the Mayan may be for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your time and money, beach view was only thing great about it.”
Reviews.Author: MomTo4Cats
Reviews.Content: They charge for parking and the room safe. Didn't have extra bath tissue. Staff was somewhat rude, not friendly at all. Had I known this, I would've stayed elsewhere. Bathroom is extremely small too.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE. SERVED ITS PURPOSE”
Reviews.Author: rvcvbcoach
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a youth volleyball tournament at the ocean center. Got a very good rate and loved the location. The only issue was noise from the bar next door. Not a great place for light sleepers. Breakfast was good and the staff was overwhelmingly helpful and friendly. I will probably stay there again next year and have people bring earplugs for the bar noise.

HotelInfo.Name: Mayan Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 103 S. Ocean Ave, Daytona Beach, FL 32118 (Formerly Best Western)
